perturbation.original_text: 16.4 Bank of America shall pay Supplier for all services and applicable taxes invoiced In arrears in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, within sixty (60) calendar days of the date of receipt of a valid and correct invoice by Bank of America. Bank of America reserves the right to pay prior to the expiration of the sixty (60) day period. If Bank of America pays within thirty (30) calendar days of receipt of a valid invoice by Bank of America, a discount of two percent (2%) will be subtracted from the total invoice amount for Services.
perturbation.changed_text: 16.4 Bank of America shall pay Supplier for all services and applicable taxes invoiced In arrears in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, within ninety (90) calendar days of the date of receipt of a valid and correct invoice by Bank of America. Bank of America reserves the right to pay prior to the expiration of the ninety (90) day period. If Bank of America pays within sixty (60) calendar days of receipt of a valid invoice by Bank of America, a discount of one percent (1%) will be subtracted from the total invoice amount for Services.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the payment terms to 90 days and reduces the early payment discount. Delayed payment contradicts standard and fair payment practices, which can affect supplier's cash flow and operations. Also, offering a mere 1% discount for significantly earlier payment is not commercially reasonable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with prompt payment laws depending on the jurisdiction and specific industry standards.

27.2 Supplier acknowledges that Bank of America has a responsibility to its customers and other consumers using Its services to keep Associate Information, Customer Information and Consumer Information strictly confidential. Each of the Parties, as Recipient, hereby agrees that it will not, and will cause its Representatives, consultants, Affiliates and independent contractors not to disclose Confidential Information of the other Party, including Associate Information,
Customer Information and Consumer Information, during or after the Term of this Agreement, other than on a "need to know" basis and then only to: (a) Affiliates of Bank of America; (b) Recipient's employees or officers; (c) Affiliates of Recipient, its independent contractors at any level, agents and consultants, provided that all such persons are subject to a written confidentiality agreement that shall be no less restrictive than the provisions of this Section; (d) pursuant to the exceptions set forth in 15 U.S.C 6802(e) and accompanying regulations, which disclosures are made in the ordinary course of business and (e) as required by law or as otherwise expressly permitted by this Agreement. Recipient shall not use or disclose Confidential Information of the other Party for any purpose other than to carry out this Agreement. Recipient shall treat Confidential Information of the other Party with no less care than it employs for its own Confidential Information of a similar nature that it does not wish to disclose, publish or disseminate, but not less than a reasonable level of care. Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason or at the written request of Bank of America during the Term of this Agreement. Supplier shall promptly return to Bank of America or destroy according to the Information Destruction Requirements described within SCHEDULE E, "Information Security . at Bank of America's election, all Bank of America Confidential Information in the possession of Supplier or Supplier's Subcontractors, subject to and in accordance with the terms and provisions of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
27.2 Supplier acknowledges that Bank of America has a responsibility to its customers and other consumers using Its services to keep Associate Information, Customer Information and Consumer Information strictly confidential. Each of the Parties, as Recipient, hereby agrees that it will not, and will cause its Representatives, consultants, Affiliates and independent contractors not to disclose Confidential Information of the other Party, including Associate Information,
Customer Information and Consumer Information, during the Term of this Agreement, other than on a "need to know" basis and then only to: (a) Affiliates of Bank of America; (b) Recipient's employees or officers; (c) Affiliates of Recipient, its independent contractors at any level, agents and consultants, provided that all such persons are subject to a written confidentiality agreement; (d) pursuant to the exceptions set forth in 15 U.S.C 6802(e) and accompanying regulations, which disclosures are made in the ordinary course of business and (e) as required by law or as otherwise expressly permitted by this Agreement. Recipient shall not use or disclose Confidential Information of the other Party for any purpose other than to carry out this Agreement. Recipient shall treat Confidential Information of the other Party with no less care than it employs for its own Confidential Information. perturbation.explanation: The modified text removes the explicit requirement that confidentiality agreements with subcontractors be 'no less restrictive' than the provisions of the original section. Also, it removes the responsibility of proper destruction (SCHEDULE E requirements) of the data; just needs to 'return' which is not legally binding. This weakens the protection of confidential information, increasing the risk of unauthorized disclosure or use after the agreement ends. The term 'Reasonable level of care' is removed, also
perturbation.contradicted_law: Violates GLBA and other privacy regulations that mandate stringent and ongoing protection of consumer financial information. Weakening confidentiality obligations after termination increases the risk of non-compliance.

perturbation.original_text: 33.1 Supplier shall maintain at no additional cost to Bank of America, in a reasonably accessible location, all Records pertaining to its Products and services provided to Bank of America under this Agreement for a period of seven (7) years or as required by law, if longer. Such Supplier Records referenced above may be inspected, audited and copied by Bank of America, its Representatives or by federal or state agencies having jurisdiction over Bank of America, during normal business hours and at such reasonable times as Bank of America and Supplier may determine. Records available for review shall exclude any records pertaining to Supplier's other customers deemed proprietary and confidential and Supplier confidential and proprietary records not associated with the Products and services provided under this Agreement. Supplier will give prior notice to Bank of America of requests by federal or state authorities to examine Supplier's Bank of America Records. At Bank of America's written request, Supplier shall reasonably cooperate with Bank of America in seeking a protective order with respect to such Records.
perturbation.changed_text: 33.1 Supplier shall maintain at no additional cost to Bank of America, in a reasonably accessible location, all Records pertaining to its Products and services provided to Bank of America under this Agreement for a period of three (3) years. Such Supplier Records referenced above may be inspected, audited and copied by Bank of America, its Representatives during normal business hours. Records available for review shall exclude any records pertaining to Supplier's other customers deemed proprietary and confidential and Supplier confidential and proprietary records not associated with the Products and services provided under this Agreement. Supplier is not obligated to give prior notice to Bank of America of requests by federal or state authorities to examine Supplier's Bank of America Records.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the record retention period to three years conflicts with regulatory requirements (potentially seven or more years). Also, removing notification requirement with authorities to examine Bank of America's records impairs the bank's ability to maintain oversight, and it limits Bank of America's representatives to inspect or audit records.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Conflicts with record retention requirements under federal banking regulations (e.g., FDIC, OCC) and state laws, depending on the specific data and services involved.
